snippet: On the back of strong results, the Abu Dhabi-based carrier reiterated its desire to add the struggling Italian flagship to its stable of airlines.
abstract: Etihad Airways, fast-growing Abu Dhabi-based carrier, reports 2013 profit rose 48 percent to $62 million, up from $42 million in 2012; reaffirms its strong interest in gaining access to European and trans-Atlantic networks of Alitalia, Italy's money-losing flagship airline.
lead_paragraph: On the back of strong results, the Abu Dhabi-based carrier reiterated its desire to add the struggling Italian flagship to its stable of airlines.

headline.main: Etihad Airways Reports Jump in Profit as It Considers Stake in Alitalia
headline.print_headline: Etihad Airways Posts Profit and Sizes Up Alitalia Stake
